Pre-Game Insights: Lithuania will be aiming to kick off their Nations League campaign in a good manner against Cyprus.
Lithuania failed to impress in the EURO 2024 qualifiers but are capable of matching Cyprus at home.
Edgaras Jankauskas' men are tough to beat at home.
Deividas Mikelionis and Mantas Bertasius have received their first call-ups for the September matches.
Cyprus aims to build on a routine 4-1 win over San Marino.
Verona forward Grigoris Kastanos will be a key player for Cyprus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Lithuania was occupied by the Soviet Union in 1940 and regained independence in 1990.
The Lithuania national football team played their first official game on June 24, 1923, with a 5-0 loss to Estonia.
Marius Stankevicius is considered Lithuania's most notable footballer.
LFF Stadium, with a capacity of 5,067, was opened in 2004 and hosts Lithuania's home games on artificial turf.
